#Text=Scottish legislature gives green light to same-sex marriage
#Text=Thursday , November 21 , 2013
#Text=Alex Neil introduced the legislation on behalf of the Scottish Government .
#Text=Image : The Scottish Government .

#Text=Members of the Scottish Parliament voted 98 – 15 in a free vote yesterday to approve the Marriage and Civil Partnerships ( Scotland ) Bill , which seeks to legalise marriage between partners of the same sex .
#Text=If the legislation is passed , Scotland may start allowing same-sex couples to marry in 2015 .

#Text=Scottish government ministers have attempted to reassure religious groups who oppose same-sex marriage they will not be required by law to conduct them , but may " opt in " to conduct ceremonies for same-sex partners .
#Text=The law also contains provisions that would protect individuals from being required to perform marriages if their congregation has opted-in but they disagree with same-sex marriage .

#Text=Alex Neil , the Scottish government health secretary , said the bill " will create a more tolerant society in Scotland and will mean that , in respect of marriage , there is genuinely equal rights right across the entire community " .
#Text=Support for the bill crossed party lines .
#Text=Jim Hume from the Liberal Democrats said the vote was " a demonstration that our Scottish society values everyone — no matter their sexuality " .

#Text=They fought for a further decade to enfranchise all women and equalise the voting ages of men and women .

_	_	_	_

#Text=Elaine Smith , also a Labour MSP , said she feared MSPs opposing same-sex marriage were being  bounced " into supporting the bill for fear of being branded homophobic . "

_	_	_	_

#Text=Since indicating that I did not intend to support the redefinition of marriage , my religion 's been disparaged , I 've been branded homophobic and bigoted , I 've been likened to the Ku Klux Klan and it was suggested that I be burnt at the stake as a witch  , Smith claimed .

#Text=John Mason from the Scottish National Party said  Parliament is not reflecting public opinion on this issue " and the public was more divided on the issue than the parliamentarians in Holyrood were .

column1: #Text=Outside the Scottish Parliament on Wednesday , a demonstration was held by the LGBT rights group Equality Network supporting the bill .
#Text=Tom French from the Equality Network said of the vote :
#Text=" Tonight the Scottish Parliament voted by an overwhelming majority to back same-sex marriage and uphold the principle that we should all be equal under the law . "
#Text=Colin Macfarlane from the gay rights group Stonewall Scotland also welcomed the vote :
#Text=" This is a truly historic step forward .

#Text=Reverend Dr William Hamilton from the Church of Scotland said while the Church opposes same-sex marriage , they stand against homophobia and  will continue to be a constructive voice in the national debate " about the bill .

column1: #Text=In July , the Marriage ( Same Sex Couples ) Bill passed into law in Westminster and will allow same-sex couples to marry in England and Wales .
